revised_title: The Evolution and Origin of the Amphibia: A Palaeontological Perspective
tldr: This lecture discusses the evolution and origin of amphibians, focusing on the study of Palaeozoic Amphibia and Labyrinthodonts. The author analyzes the changes in the skull, brain case, and other skeletal structures of these ancient creatures, tracing their evolution from terrestrial to aquatic forms. The lecture also highlights the importance of palaeontological evidence in understanding the origin of the amphibian group.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Vertebrate Paleontology
